posts.post_content:
Persist! ([Kitchen Finks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kitchen Finks), [Twilight Shepherd](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twilight Shepherd), [Murderous Redcap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murderous Redcap))  
Tokens! ([Raise the Alarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raise the Alarm), [Spectral Procession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Procession), [Battle Screech](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Battle Screech), [Conqueror's Pledge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conqueror's Pledge), [Nomads' Assembly](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nomads' Assembly), [Verdant Embrace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Embrace), [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth), [Fresh Meat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fresh Meat))   
  
This card is fun. It starts out innocuously just out of bolt range. Then after playing Conqueror's Pledge it is suddenly a 8/10. And unlike many creatures that get crazy big, this one had an effect on your other creatures. Instant speed token generators like raise the alarm become mini permanent giant growths!
posts.html:
Persist! (Kitchen Finks, Twilight Shepherd, Murderous Redcap)
Tokens! (Raise the Alarm, Spectral Procession, Battle Screech, Conqueror's Pledge, Nomads' Assembly, Verdant Embrace, Mycoloth, Fresh Meat)

This card is fun. It starts out innocuously just out of bolt range. Then after playing Conqueror's Pledge it is suddenly a 8/10. And unlike many creatures that get crazy big, this one had an effect on your other creatures. Instant speed token generators like raise the alarm become mini permanent giant growths!
Report Abuse

posts.post_content: This guy is sick with [Ghave, Guru of Spores](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghave, Guru of Spores). Pay ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) to remove a counter from [Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger) and put a 1/1 sporling creature on the battlefield. Both the sporling and [Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger) get a counter. So it's essentially a 2/2 token for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol). Good stuff with [Bear Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bear Umbra).
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Flavor Text:   
  
"All that is gold does not glitter. Not all those who wander are lost."  
  
This needs to appear on a Magic card someday. Actually, rather than put it on a Ranger, where the overt Tolkien-reference would be even more obvious and heavy-handed, I think that line would be OUTSTANDING as 'the first Flavor Text to appear on a Planeswalker'.
posts.html:
